discourse_list.title: Circle started freezing USDC which went through Tornado Cash

content.content: The U.S. government started an official raid against Tornado cash and everything related to Tornado. This brings a big problem for DAI and MakerDAO.   twitter.com    banteg @bantg  Circle just frozen 75,000 USDC belonging to unsuspecting Tornado users, as well as 149 USDC donated to the project. https://t.co/GBS41FtZvB   6:43 PM - 8 Aug 2022           1.5K                390            It is practically obvious that if they can do it they will do it, USDC and other stable currencies linked to some entity are a big problem for Maker.

I strongly support that any entity that physically establishes a cryptocurrency will be regulated in this way sooner or later and therefore we need to decrease our excessive USDC exposure but do you know the intentions behind this freeze? It could have been unbacked money or possibly a scam and so it was frozen, it’s part of the crypto cleanup if this isn’t a scam cleanup and it’s just a malicious raid by centralized entities we should set off alarms.

Here is the release from the government.    U.S. Department of the Treasury    U.S. Treasury Sanctions Notorious Virtual Currency Mixer Tornado Cash WASHINGTON – Today, the U.S. Department of the Treasury’s Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) sanctioned virtual currency mixer Tornado Cash, which has been used to launder more than $7 billion worth of virtual currency since its creation in...

This is what I was referring to, decentralization is good up to a point, Tornado Cash is a cancer for the crypto world, it loses the essentials of Blockchain technology and makes the reputation of “security and monitoring” that cryptocurrencies have is nullified, so this according to this measure of Circle

As a very brief background, the US Treasury Office of Foreign Asset Control (OFAC) this morning issued a release, sanctioning Tornado Cash and specifically calling out a number of Ethereum addresses associated with Tornado Cash as "SDN"s or Specially Designated Nationals that US individuals or companies are prohibited from doing business with, subject to civil and criminal penalties. A quick review suggests the addresses blacklisted are the same addresses that OFAC added to the SDN list.

It’s not a lot of money, but this tells us something and we should set the alarm bells ringing… With this now the money launderers will migrate to Dai, after that it can be very dangerous for Maker because the U.S. treasury could also target and sanction Maker as it did with tornado Cash.

twitter.com    tobal.eth 🦇🔊 #L222 @ ETH Latam @tobalgarcia_  Well, people:  $DAI, the ERC-20 token generated by the Maker Protocol, can *not* be frozen.  Yes, @MakerDAO TVL is ~30% USDC. More than 3 billion.  But, besides that, let’s be honest, USDC is one of the largest liquidity providers on crypto.   11:05 PM - 8 Aug 2022           8                1

I respect tobal, I have shared with him in several spaces and I consider him a friend, but it seems to me particularly the least correct assessment that can be made, we are MakerDAO, and more than 80% of our supply is in USDC or similar. We don’t talk about that in the other protocols, because MakerDAO has as a flag the resistance to censorship, a free money for all, what if that money is susceptible to fail? susceptible to lose that support? susceptible to those attacks from regulators? We represent more than 12% of the current TLV of all DEFI regardless of the chain.
See my comments on Proposal for the avoidance of possible future sanctions

I disagree. Even if tornado cash is not the best way, it represents anonymity and privacy, which is part of the ethos along with freedom for crypto and blockchain. I view the freeze as the 1st attack on crypto.

I respect your point of view, but it seems that “anonymity” in this case is not used to a good extent and the provisions will be a daily bread in the future, the regulators will not care at all that tornado cash represents anonymity and privacy decentralization , we must ensure the good of Maker and what has just happened with Tornado Cash is not encouraging, it would not be the first warning with Coinbase or Circle, I do not want us to leave Coinbase aside, in fact the association with BlackRock pleases me exaggeratedly, but if we diversify it is much more enjoyable

Everything is a tool. I have mentioned on Twitter that you can have freedom or nuke all evil and be “compliant”. You cannot have both. No evil means no freedom as no one can do wrong in the eyes of the given authority. Having freedom means accepting a ying/yang and knowing evil will exist as a fact of life. There can be a spectrum here, but it’s a very slippery slope on justifications. We want freedom. If maker DAO wants to be “safe” to the masses, they become a CBDC by proxy and are no longer relevant to the community. I do not want us to leave Coinbase aside, in fact, the association with BlackRock pleases me exaggeratedly, but if we diversify, it is much more enjoyable US Govt paid BlackRock to buy up all the US property and also used with boomer retirement funds. This is to push the you will own nothing and be happy agenda by the IMF. US Govt = Blackrock = Circle = Coinbase = USDC = CBDC. It may sound like a tinfoil hat now, but many never thought the government would nuke tornado and GitHub code and personal accounts. The reality is that crypto was created for freedom, bringing that to the masses. This is the fight that defines the future. You have no reason to exist if you become “compliant” with their money rules. It’s that simple.

Hi all, taking the recent event into account where TornadoCash has been put on the OFAC sanctions list, leading to Circle freezing 75,000 USDC belonging to unsuspecting Tornado users, as well as 149 USDC donated to the project, and infura_io and Alchemy blocking RPC requests to TornadoCash we need to act in MakerDAO. Before we act, we need to carefully consider the consequences and what to do. I have put together this response plan trying to connect the dots and push forward the work. Suggested background music while reading: Musical Youth Pass the Dutchie - YouTube I will update the response plan daily, feel free to chip in if you have anything to add or if you want to join the work. RESPONSE PLAN:  docs.google.com    MakerDAOs response plan to the TornadoCash/USDC-event MakerDAOs response plan to the TornadoCash/USDC-event  Readers instruction: I have put together this response plan, feel free to chip in, if you have anything to add or if you want to join the work.  I will use this as my working document and will...

pcfreak30:  I disagree. Even if tornado cash is not the best way, it represents anonymity and privacy, which is part of the ethos along with freedom for crypto and blockchain. I view the freeze as the 1st attack on crypto.   I agree with your point of view, code is law and although perhaps Tornado cash is a hacker’s baia, several users did not use it for that purpose, it allowed to continue using this blockchain and maintain anonymity and privacy.     Balloonist:  Hi all, taking the recent event into account where TornadoCash has been put on the OFAC sanctions list, leading to Circle freezing 75,000 USDC belonging to unsuspecting Tornado users, as well as 149 USDC donated to the project, and infura_io and Alchemy blocking RPC requests to TornadoCash  we need to act in MakerDAO.   Thank you very much for your contribution, without a doubt, it is necessary to organize for a joint response.     Moi:  I respect your point of view, but it seems that “anonymity” in this case is not used to a good extent and the provisions will be a daily bread in the future, the regulators will not care at all that tornado cash represents anonymity and privacy decentralization , we must ensure the good of Maker and what has just happened with Tornado Cash is not encouraging, it would not be the first warning with Coinbase or Circle, I do not want us to leave Coinbase aside, in fact the association with BlackRock pleases me exaggeratedly, but if we diversify it is much more enjoyable   There is a popular crypto saying, “Bitcoin is your enemy’s money” being in crypto we must be agnostic to whoever uses it no matter if it is used by the most tyrannical government or the most woke young man out there, crypto and bitcoin must be agnostic, it is the basis of the fundamentals: 1 Decentralized 2 anonymous 3 Free. Tornado cash allowed to recover that anonymity that has been lost, a hard blow.

USDC in the PSM is currently sitting in MKRs wallet idle. Unlike USDC used in Tornado Cash that was used to launder and transfer money to North Korean Sanctioned organizations. Its not the same…The OFAC is going after Mixers used for Money Laundering and other illicit activity.

Really you dont see the problem? Dai cant be frozen. What if the US government decides Dai and similar stablecoins can be used as a tool to evade sanctions and finance North Korea. And order circle to freeze all the collateral backing Dai even when there is collateral damage? We are one bad narrative away from the stable collateral getting banned. Especially with new clarity and regulations. Dai will probably fail to comply. I am surprised that this risk is not self evident and logical to people in the community.
Can you explain how Circle would be able to freeze DAI? Geniunely asking to understand the risk.

Is funny to see this, ppl think is just a problem for Maker. Maker is one of the BIGGEST USDC holders, if Circle blacklist Maker: first will shoot at its own foot. Second the entire DeFi will break, I’m not talking about a Terra Catastrophe, I’m talking that you guys should go and change everything for Bitcoin or Fiat cuz we’ll be f*cked (all of us). Still yeah, Maker needs to make DAI more decentralized again, but lets not freak out for this.

This is my lay understanding, so it’s subject to rebuttal by more knowledgeable developers, but essentially:  MakerDAO has a smart contract, the PSM, with billions of DAI and USDC in it. Also/relatedly, MakerDAO is associated with thousands of Vaults with USDC that have been used as collateral for issuance of millions or billions of DAI.  Circle could add the addresses of all Maker Vaults containing DAI and the PSM to it’s blacklist. Because any transactions [edit: involving USDC], including PSM and liquidation transactions require interacting with the USDC Smart Contract, and because that smart contract would no longer accept such interactions, those vaults would no longer be liquidatable, and there would no longer be a reliable exit point from DAI to USDC (and implicitly, to fiat). So while DAI transactions could continue, the DAI itself would no longer be collateralized the same way. Also, any liquidity pools that held both DAI and USDC would potentially stop functioning, and DAI in those pools could be directly frozen.

0xbocaJ:  Circle could add the addresses of all Maker Vaults containing DAI and the PSM to it’s blacklist.   I partially understand the concern but would help if you could answer: Why would OFAC target the PSM smart contract and not the ETH address (USDC or DAI) that is committing the crimes? There are many ways of swapping USDC for DAI, all DEXs (Uniswap, Sushiswap, etc) allow for it. Would they be at risk too?

I think so too. I find it even worse that many people here seem to completely disregard the threat that exists and take it for what it is. @TRUEMAKER blacklist all contract addresses of every pool? Is it not that obvious? It really is like signing a document with a stroke of a key sign to destroy DAI overnight and then cause a UST death spiral.

Because why would they not target the platform that enables unrestricted access to finance without them in control? Sure they will make another headline. Maybe Russia uses USDC and MakerDAO with uniswap to bypass sanctions and fund the war on Ukraine?? Does that NOT sound like a realistic headline to you?
Saw this tweet and thought it might be informative: https://twitter.com/TonyaJoRiley/status/1556992817506959363?s=20&t=4Z3NdWDHPh9JSJ4u-atmFg  image1170×844 102 KB

Its a trivial matter to identify which pools / adresses hold the collateral USDC. The government will simply order circle to blacklist entire pools and take that collateral damage they just need to sanction Dai. I mean in tornado cash they didnt discriminate between guilty and not guilty. It will be a heavy blow for circle but its the us government we are talking about they can do anything if its about national security. MakerDao is operating under the assumption that they are allowed to operate, the us government could make ridiculous demands to keep Dai under control. I honestly think that the current trajectory of makerdao is not possible to execute. Why would the us government accept that there is a stablecoin pegged to the dollar that they cant freeze.They can freeze the collateral and I dont see a reason why they wont if they decide that Dai is being used by russia/north korea for anything. Stablecoin backing should be something managable like 5-10%  from different stablecoins. I understand there are many people on the payroll on maker. They want to legitimize Dai to keep the money flowing. But this will only work if Dai becomes freezable, censorable, permissioned. And at this point there is really no need for Dai anymore.

This is not panic. I am talking about reducing or eliminating stablecoin reliance for ages. Entire Defi wont break. Synthetix will be completly unaffected for example and just keep on doing its thing. Also you are under the impression that circle has a choice to not comply. They do not have a choice, even if they shoot themselfs in the foot. The tornado cash sanctioning was the first step. Doesnt mean it will end here. We need to discuss this and be proactive. Because that is currently by far the biggest risk factor. Also there is no yield for the PSM Dai so why does it even matter. And generating yield by buying government bonds will make makerdao just more vulnerable.

Ber10:  Stablecoin backing should be something managable like 5-10% from different stablecoins. I understand there are many people on the payroll on maker.   Fair enough, most of the community agrees with this point. The reality is that the shift to being mostly USDC collateralized has happened fast and driven by the market and not by CU’s actions, not many in MKR want DAI to become a wUSDC. There are limited options that a USD PSM can pair with but it is possible to diversify if the incentives are right (e.g. lower fees in other PSM vaults vs USDC) or by using alternative options like Synthetix.
pcfreak30:  Does that NOT sound like a realistic headline to you?   How exactly would ‘Russia go about using USDC and MakerDAO’ to bypass sanctions?

Buy DAI from ETH/WETH, and use it to fund their operators like it’s a stable BTC. They could mine ETH, or even mine BTC, and swap on a DEX. If BTC, they could use thorchain, get ETH, swap ETH for DAI, then hold that as a USD war chest, then send that to gun makers, etc. You then have the president claiming that DAI is enabling the war on Ukraine and bypassing sanctions, and it needs to be stopped and everyone arrested. This happens because DAI can not be frozen, and there’s no one to appeal to. If it could be, it’s no better than USDC. How real does that sound to you? Regardless of anyone feelings on Russia vs Ukraine, this is a real scenario. Normal users are not savvy enough to do this, but a crypto user would find it easy to do. You would have ignorant people cheering b/c Russia’s “evil deeds” (think a cartoon villain) were stopped, but in reality, they just crashed ETH Defi in crypto with the excuse of trying to stop Russia. This would be a Terra + 3AC contagion event on an exponential scale, and the number of CEX companies caught off guard would probably crash us below 10k BTC, which the government would prob buy the dip   Scary yet?

Alchemy & Infura blocking RPC requests to tornado cash   The Block    Infura and Alchemy are now blocking access to Tornado Cash Blockchain RPC endpoint providers Infura and Alchemy are blocking access to Tornado Cash from the front-end code.

Perhaps we should rethink if MakerDAO should have a fully decentralized currency solution additional to DAI (our Single-Collateral DAI). The problem we address is somewhat broader than USDC, it is being able to offer a fully decentralized currency pegged to the Dollar. A space that at the moment is only occupied by Liquity, which may also be the solution. In the end, how it has emerged that one of the needs that this space has is a stable currency that is at the highest level of decentralization and that happens by using ETH as collateral. There is no other possibility. That space was occupied by MakerDAO in its first implementation and they had some serious limitations of growth as we know. Multicollateralized DAI has been a great way to grow, but the need for a fully stable currency that is extremely uncensorable has not gone away. I think that is the currency that should replace at least the USDC reserves

DAI is not a censorship proof stablecoin. This idea was forfeited already when USDC was introduced and when RWA backing was pulled up as a major future headwind. DAI is on track to be come the most decentralized stablecoin. That’s still possible.

What makes you think that Dai will be able to comply with the requirements for stablecoins: https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/senate-bill/3970/text None of this applies to Dai. Also most decentralized stablecoin? If the collateral is centrally controlled (Bonds stablecoins) its not decentralized. Dai is on track to become useless. I dont understand the value proposition anymore. The only feature is that you can borrow against your crypto. Only that the token you get has additional regulatory risk compared to the others that you can borrow against and are truly decentralized (LUSD, RAI, sUSD just three of the top of my head. Soon AAVES stable aswell. Dai is in a unique position. Taking on the disadvantages of centrally issued stablecoins: Censorable And the disadvantages of decentralized stablecoins: No regulations, unclear legal status. And this combination introduces new risk into the system. There is ofcourse an advantage of a non income producing liquidity boost. Dai needs a new and honest narrative. Its not that decentralized and not that censorship resistant and has significant regulatory risk but you can borrow against your crypto assets a token that has decent liquidity and a good track record.
Thank you for your insightful comments and accurate observations here @Ber10 and @pcfreak30. You can sleep well at night knowing you rang the alarm, blood is not on your hands.

Ber10:  The only feature is that you can borrow against your crypto. Only that the token you get has additional regulatory risk compared to the others that you can borrow against and are truly decentralized (LUSD, RAI, sUSD just three of the top of my head. Soon AAVES stable aswell.   Really insightful post. I would argue that LUSD, RAI have their own risks as well starting with the PEG which ultimately creates volatility between the amount borrowed and amount to be repaid. There is a stablecoin spectrum (USDT/USDC to RAI/sUSD) and I think DAI aims to be somewhere in the middle. As a community though we should decide where we want to be. Based on real-time collateral backing metrics, DAI is fast approaching USDC/USDT status. Even though the market has shifted towards safety, MKR governance actions have also pushed DAI towards the censorable part of the balance (MKR sets debt limit on the different products: PSM, RWA, vaults,etc). Those are the things we can control to shift the balance back to decentralization, if thats what we want. Most MIPs I see focus on RWA, Bond strategies and few aim towards peg range  or crypto vault incentives, so I am thinking the community is also responsible for this shift. What is the right balance between competing priorities: PEG maintenance and decentralization? You will notice that the community is divided between what DAI’s allowable PEG range should be for optimal use which drives DAI collateral.
Kudos . Just glad to see some agree.

I would also take inspiration from FRAX and see what they are doing with their cross-chain collateral. You could back DAI with FRAX, but since it has backing by USDC via Curve, which circle would need to be blacklisted… I somehow feel you could get another UST situation.

I think it would actually be a good idea to start a thread were people can talk about ways to decrease the stablecoin backing substantially with the least risk possible involved. I think it couldnt hurt to replace 2% of the USDC position with ethereum backed stablecoins. Another 5% with Eth. And remove the ability of the PSM to mint Dai. Or make it prohibitively expensive. If makers Eth position would be underwater Dai price might dip under 1 Dollar and a bankrun would start and the PSM would start reinstating the peg and burn a lot of Dai. Also maker could use the Eth to stake, rEth comes to mind.

Curious if any of you fine folks can verify what’s being discussed in this Twitter thread and what you think the implications will be if Maker vault holders get the treatment .     banteg   @bantg  It appears http://oasis.app, following Uniswap, has started sending all your data to TRM Labs. This is what happens when you connect with an address they don’t like. No way to close positions from the UI, no explanation or anything.   twitter.com    banteg @bantg  It appears oasis.app, following Uniswap, has started sending all your data to TRM Labs. This is what happens when you connect with an address they don't like. No way to close positions from the UI, no explanation or anything. https://t.co/n2ocN8jQTq   4:19 PM - 11 Aug 2022           590                140
